channel.description: Recent content in asahi on Small Technical Blog

item.title: Linuxboot with Asahi Linux Kernel on Macbook
item.description: Goal: Boot an Asahi Linux kernel and an u-root initramfs on a water-damaged Apple-Silicon Macbook At some point I encountered myself with a Macbook Air booting Asahi’s m1n1 in proxy mode, without being able to boot MacOS or doing anything else with it, since the power button was fatally damaged. Introduction Why did I buy a Macbook and how I accidentally destroyed it Even if I definitely am a Linux-kind-of-person, I got myself an entry-level MacBook Air M1 which should fullfill the following purposes:
